Articles.Content: I just wanted to ask some things that I noticed on the devblog. So firstly will rovers be prone to spinning out. Does this mean that steering a lot to a side will spin you out and not do wonky stuff. Does this mean that Infinitraction will be fixed?

It's not that they will be prone to spinning out, it's that they will be more likely to spin out or "drift" rather than the whole rover suddenly rolling over like it does now.  It should behave more like a real car, not impossible to roll over but not as likely as skidding the tires.  Of course this would all depend on how you build it, but if you are building something low to the ground and wider/longer rather than taller it should behave more realistically.  It will still be possible to build the SUV of rovers and roll it though.

Edited January 29, 2016 by Alshain
